metadata.cwe: CWE-95: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')
metadata.description: User controlled data in eval() or similar functions may result in Server Side Injection or Remote Code Injection
POST Request to Express Body Parser 'bodyParser()' can create Temporary files and consume space.
metadata.owasp: A9: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

metadata.cwe: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
metadata.description: Untrusted user input in redirect() can result in Open Redirect vulnerability.

files.match_string: res.send(req.t("There was an issue finding versions to diff"));
res.send(req.t("There was an issue finding versions to diff"));

metadata.cwe: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
metadata.description: Untrusted User Input in Response will result in Reflected Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability.

metadata.cwe: CWE-644: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax
metadata.description: Untrusted user input in response header will result in HTTP Header Injection or Response Splitting Attacks.

metadata.cwe: CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory (Path Traversal)
metadata.description: Path constructed with user input can result in Path Traversal. Ensure that user input does not reach `join()` or `resolve()`.

files.match_string: var apiKey = "AIzaSyDqLwQV7Cz6fNdxXREADBAxwBgfyjoE_s8";  // CHANGE THIS FOR YOUR KEY

metadata.description: A hardcoded API Key is identified. Store it properly in an environment variable.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: crypto.pseudoRandomBytes()/Math.random() is a cryptographically weak random number generator.
metadata.owasp: A9: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

metadata.cwe: CWE-807: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
metadata.description: User controlled data is used for application business logic decision making. This expose protected data or functionality.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: MD5 is a a weak hash which is known to have collision. Use a strong hashing function.
metadata.owasp: A9: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

metadata.cwe: CWE-943: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Data Query Logic
metadata.description: Untrusted user input in findOne() function can result in NoSQL Injection.

metadata.cwe: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
metadata.description: Untrusted input concatinated with raw SQL query can result in SQL Injection.
A hardcoded username in plain text is identified. Store it properly in an environment variable.
Ensure that the regex used to compare with user supplied input is safe from regular expression denial of service.

metadata.cwe: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
metadata.description: The EJS/ECT template has an unescaped variable. Untrusted user input passed to this variable results in Cross Site Scripting (XSS).
